problem_state_summary: The problem involves a spatial arrangement depicted in a diagram where specific objects need to be counted and compared. The task is to determine if the number of tiny gray bicycles on the left side of a brown metal sedan is greater than the number of things to the left of a tiny green bicycle. The problem requires visual inspection to identify and count these objects accurately. The diagram includes a brown metal sedan, tiny gray bicycles, and a tiny green bicycle. The exact number of these objects and their positions are not provided in the text and must be determined from the image. The problem is presented as a multiple-choice question with two options: Yes or No.
unknowns: number of tiny gray bicycles on the left side of the brown metal sedan
number of things to the left of the tiny green bicycle
required_operations: Identify the brown metal sedan in the diagram
Count the tiny gray bicycles on the left side of the sedan
Identify the tiny green bicycle in the diagram
Count the objects to the left of the tiny green bicycle
blockers: number of tiny gray bicycles on the left side of the brown metal sedan
number of things to the left of the tiny green bicycle
risk_checks: Ensure correct identification of the brown metal sedan and bicycles
Verify the spatial arrangement and count accuracy
Check for any visual markers or labels that might aid in counting

multiple_choice.answer_format: Return final as option label or exact value per instruction
